doc.title: Earth in the Air
doc.plot: On April 14, 1935 the blackest cloud of the dustbowl rolled across the Midwest. It was widely known as Black Tuesday.When the storm leaves a mans house uninhabitable, he travels westward. Likewise, other dust bowl refugees headed west in an attempt to start new and escape the worst natural disaster in American history. But what began as a journey to find life and opportunity became a struggle to simply survive.
